fact_check_explanation_title: Article saying gardening is a sign of ‘far-right extremism’ does not exist
fact_check_explanation_summary: A digitally manipulated screenshot of a Canadian news site has been shared widely online.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many Russian soldiers have died in Ukraine?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Estimates vary from as few as 6,000 to as many as 55,000.

fact_check_explanation_title: Liz Truss wrong to repeatedly say energy bills are capped at £2,500
fact_check_explanation_summary: This figure is based on the amount a “typical” household with average use will pay—but total bills aren’t capped.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of Italian protesters removing European flag from building is from 2013
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed that the video was filmed during the recent general election in Italy.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about vaccine adverse events based on article since-deleted over inaccuracies
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Express headline is being shared to claim the truth about the Covid-19 vaccine is “starting to unravel”. The article in question was deleted after the Express acknowledged it was …

fact_check_explanation_title: Keir Starmer’s 2022 Labour party conference speech: fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: We look at the Labour leader’s claims on tax cuts, burglaries and offshore wind, and whether Labour policies are fully costed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Andy Burnham did not say he was a ‘better politician’ than Keir Starmer
fact_check_explanation_summary: A headline, now changed, of an article published by The Sun misleadingly claimed Greater Manchester mayor Andy Burnham said he was a “better politician” than Keir Starmer.

fact_check_explanation_title: The deficit is lower than it was 12 years ago
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves said in a speech that the Conservative government had not got the deficit down during 12 years in power. This isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: Liz Truss wrong to claim ‘no household’ will pay more than £2,500 on energy bills
fact_check_explanation_summary: During an interview on CNN the Prime Minister claimed ‘nobody’ would have to pay more than £2,500 in energy bills. Per the government’s own figures, this isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu vaccines may contain harmless levels of formaldehyde
fact_check_explanation_summary: Formaldehyde is naturally present in our bodies, and there isn’t enough in vaccines to harm us.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ed Davey left out important context about energy bills
fact_check_explanation_summary: Yes, annual household bills will rise about £500 in October, but people will also receive a £400 discount under the Energy Bills Support Scheme.

fact_check_explanation_title: Will 16 million patients be left without a GP by 2030?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Figures projecting a shortfall of 8,800 GPs by 2030 don’t necessarily suggest that one in four people will be without a GP by the end of the decade.
